response:
MRI is the gold standard to confirm the anatomical lesions and demonstrate Dissemination in Space and Time required for an MS diagnosis. CSF analysis aids in confirming inflammatory pathology (oligoclonal bands). Blood tests are required to exclude mimics (NMO/MOG antibodies), screen for infection, and investigate the systemic symptoms of hypothyroidism (TSH/T4) suggested by the presenting complaint.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Spinal Cord with Gadolinium", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Lumbar Puncture for CSF analysis", "Thyroid Function Tests (TSH, T4)", "Serum Aquaporin-4 (AQP4) antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA, dsDNA)", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Syphilis serology", "Lyme disease serology"]
